channel.title: Personal on Andi Altendorfer
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on Andi Altendorfer

item.title: Hello, and welcome (Post#0)
item.description:
I’m so incredibly happy to finally have my own little corner of the internet. For a long time, I’ve wanted a space where I could share my thoughts, projects, and whatever else comes to mind, without the distractions of social media. After a lot of tinkering, I’ve built this blog using Hugo, and I couldn’t be more excited to start publishing here.

This is a space for me to write freely and connect with a community that shares similar interests. I’m glad you’ve stopped by, and I hope you’ll stick around. You can expect to find posts on [Your topics here, e.g., web development, hiking, creative writing], but really, it’s just a place for whatever new ideas I have.

item.title: I love daisies in my garden 🌼
item.description: BTW, I love daisies not only in SW - even more in my garden where they pop up everywhere these days 🌼

item.title: I'm both near- and farsighted...
item.description: I’m both near- and farsighted, working with three screens, sometimes writing on my phone or checking my watch. Until now, I needed up to 4 pairs of #glasses at my desk. Finally, I found a pair of progressive lenses that replaces them all! So happy! 😃although very expensive 😕

item.title: Oh, sorry! I didn't mean to disturb your morning sunbathing.
item.description:
Oh, sorry! I didn’t mean to disturb your morning sunbathing.

A peaceful riverside scene featuring a duck resting near the water’s edge. The foreground is filled with lush greenery and young leaves, framing the view of the calm river. In the background, a dense forest of tall trees stretches out, creating a serene and natural atmosphere. The soft morning light adds a gentle glow to the scene, highlighting the tranquility of the moment. ALT

item.title: 😥 R.I.P. Garth Hudson (The Band)
item.description:
😥

‪The New York Times‬ ‪@nytimes.com‬ · 8mo Breaking News: Garth Hudson, the last surviving original member of the Band, died in Woodstock, New York, at 87. The Band was one of the most influential rock groups of the 1960s and ’70s.

Garth Hudson, Multifaceted Musician With the Band, Dies at 87 He was the last surviving original member of one of the most influential groups of the 1960s and ’70s, with its blend of rock, r&b and country. www.nytimes.com

item.title: Early X-mas gift
item.description: Early X-mas gift: Does anyone know the feeling, as a developer, of being able to shut down the server for a client who was just annoying, because they finally canceled? 🕺

item.title: I don’t understand...
item.description: I don’t understand how people can click the ♥️ on news about someone has been killed. No matter who.

item.title: I’m proudly announcing that I just deactivated my X-account.
item.description: I’m proudly announcing that I just deactivated my X-account.

item.title: Welcome at bluesky 🙂.
item.description:
Welcome! I’m happy leaving that old mess and start a new and clean ‘life’ here at bluesky 🙂.

Have a nice and pleasant Christmas season!
